intro: Anthericum liliago f. macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited lily of the wall, is a botanical variant of the common lily of the wall. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces large, elongated berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native range.
